interestingFact: There are 195 countries in the world today, including 193 United Nations member states and 2 observer states.
Nepal is home to Mount Everest, the tallest mountain in the world, standing at 8,848 meters.
The Pyramids of Giza are one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.
Australia is home to the Great Barrier Reef, the largest coral reef system in the world.
Brazil is home to the Amazon Rainforest, the largest tropical rainforest in the world.
The Eiffel Tower in Paris was once the tallest man-made structure in the world.
Russia is the largest country in the world by area, covering more than 17 million square kilometers.
The Great Wall of China is visible from space on rare occasions.
Pakistan is home to K2, the second-highest mountain in the world, and five of the 14 highest peaks above 8,000 meters.
India is the world’s largest democracy and is known as the birthplace of major religions like Hinduism, Buddhism, Jainism, and Sikhism.
Japan is renowned for its technological innovations and is home to the world’s fastest trains, the Shinkansen.
Saudi Arabia is the birthplace of Islam and home to the two holiest cities, Makkah and Madinah.
The UAE is home to Burj Khalifa, the tallest building in the world at 828 meters.
Turkey uniquely sits on two continents, Asia and Europe, with Istanbul being the only city in the world spanning both.
Iran is famous for its rich Persian history and architectural wonders like Persepolis.
South Korea is a global leader in technology and is the birthplace of K-pop, which has taken the world by storm.
Indonesia is the world’s largest archipelago, consisting of over 17,000 islands.
Thailand is the only Southeast Asian country that was never colonized by a European power.
Malaysia is home to the Petronas Twin Towers, which were once the tallest buildings in the world.
Mexico introduced chocolate, chili, and corn to the world.
Kenya is famous for its wildlife safaris and the Great Rift Valley.
Argentina is the birthplace of tango and home to the Andes Mountains.
South Africa is known as the 'Rainbow Nation' due to its diverse cultures and languages.
Spain is famous for flamenco music, bullfighting, and the running of the bulls festival in Pamplona.
Canada has the longest coastline in the world, stretching over 202,000 kilometers.
Italy is home to the Colosseum and has more UNESCO World Heritage sites than any other country.
Germany is famous for its Autobahn highways, some sections of which have no speed limit.
The UK is home to the world’s oldest underground railway, the London Underground, which opened in 1863.
Vietnam is the largest exporter of cashew nuts and black pepper in the world.
The Philippines is made up of over 7,600 islands, making it one of the largest archipelagos in the world.
Switzerland is famous for its neutrality and has not participated in any war since 1815.
Sweden is the origin of the Nobel Prizes, awarded annually in Stockholm.
Norway is known for its stunning fjords and is one of the happiest countries in the world.
Denmark is considered one of the happiest countries and is the birthplace of LEGO.
Finland is called the land of a thousand lakes, though it has over 180,000 lakes.
Iceland runs almost entirely on renewable energy, mainly geothermal and hydroelectric.
Greece is the birthplace of democracy and the Olympic Games.
Portugal is the world’s largest producer of cork.
The Netherlands is famous for windmills, tulips, and a cycling-friendly culture.
Belgium is known for waffles, chocolates, and being the headquarters of the EU.
Poland is home to the largest castle in the world, Malbork Castle.
Austria is known for classical composers like Mozart and Beethoven.
Hungary is famous for its thermal baths and paprika spice.
The Czech Republic is known for its beer culture, being the world’s highest beer consumer per capita.
Slovakia has more castles per capita than any other country in the world.
Croatia’s coastline along the Adriatic Sea is famous for its stunning islands.
Serbia is home to the EXIT music festival, one of Europe’s biggest.
Romania is famous for the legend of Dracula and Bran Castle.
Bulgaria is one of the oldest countries in Europe, established in 681 AD.
Ukraine is the largest country entirely in Europe.
Kazakhstan is the world’s largest landlocked country.
Uzbekistan is famous for the Silk Road city of Samarkand.
Afghanistan is known for its rugged mountains and historical Silk Road trade routes.
Bangladesh is the world’s largest producer of jute and has the largest river delta.
Sri Lanka is known as the ‘Pearl of the Indian Ocean’ for its beauty.
Myanmar is home to thousands of ancient temples in Bagan.
Singapore is one of the world’s smallest countries but a global financial hub.
New Zealand is famous for its Maori culture and being the filming location of The Lord of the Rings.
Chile is the world’s longest country from north to south.
Colombia is the world’s largest producer of emeralds.
Peru is home to Machu Picchu, one of the New Seven Wonders of the World.
Venezuela has Angel Falls, the highest waterfall in the world.
Ethiopia is one of the oldest nations in the world and the origin of coffee.
Nigeria is Africa’s most populous country and home to Nollywood, one of the largest film industries.
Ecuador is named after the equator, which runs through the country.
Morocco is famous for its historic city of Marrakech and Sahara Desert.
Algeria is Africa’s largest country by land area.
Tunisia was the location for many Star Wars movie scenes.
Iraq is the location of ancient Mesopotamia, considered the cradle of civilization.
Damascus is one of the oldest continuously inhabited cities in the world.
Jordan is home to Petra, one of the New Seven Wonders of the World.
Lebanon is known for its ancient cities and delicious cuisine, including hummus and tabbouleh.
Qatar hosted the FIFA World Cup in 2022, the first Middle Eastern nation to do so.
Kuwait has one of the world’s highest per-capita incomes thanks to its oil reserves.
Oman is known for its frankincense and stunning desert landscapes.
Yemen’s capital Sana’a is one of the oldest continuously inhabited cities in the world.
Sudan has more pyramids than Egypt.
Eritrea’s capital, Asmara, is known for its Italian-style architecture.
Somalia has the longest coastline on mainland Africa.
Madagascar is famous for its unique wildlife, with 90% of its species found nowhere else.
